decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - The proposal constitutes development under the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, and the local planning authority is not satisfied that, based on the drawings submitted as part of the application, this proposal falls within any class of 'permitted development' specified within Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
INFORMATIVE: The proposed development fails to comply with condition C.1 (b), A.1 (f)(i), A.1 (f)(ii), A.1 (h)(i), A.1 (i), A.1 (j), A.1 (ja), B.1 (d), B.2 (b)(i) B.2 (b) (ii) and B.2 (c). of Classes A, B and C of Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) for the following reasons:
C.1 (b) Proposed works do not form an alteration to an original roof and more than 0.15m higher due to change in pitch.

A.1 (f) (i) The enlarged part of the dwellinghouse would have a single storey and would be more than 3m deep where the extension is not a detached property.

A.1 (f) (ii) The enlarged part of the dwellinghouse would exceed 4 metres in height.

A.1 (h) (i) If considered as two-storey extension given the windows below, the depth of the rear extension would be more than 3m deep.

A.1 (i) the enlarged part of the dwellinghouse would be within 2 metres of the boundary of the curtilage of the dwellinghouse, and the height of the eaves of the enlarged part would exceed 3 metres (both rear/side).

A.1 (j) the enlarged part of the dwellinghouse would extend beyond a wall forming a side elevation of the original dwellinghouse, and would be more than 4m in height (both rear/side), is potentially more than single storey and would have a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse given the two-storey rear addition is not original.

description: Alterations including erection of hip to gable and rear and side dormer roof extensions; erection of single-storey rear and side extensions.
